column1: You had surgery to prevent the aneurysm from bleeding or to treat the aneurysm after it bled.
There are two types of surgery: - Open craniotomy, during which the doctor makes a hole in your skull to place a clip on the base of the aneurysm.
Be sure you understand any instructions about taking medicines such as blood thinners (anticoagulants), aspirin, or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), such as ibuprofen and naproxen.
